content: Investments Asked by Zach HoweAsked on 09 Feb 2019Just got CDP, how to link with SSB?I just have a CDP account created but do not have any brokerage account with any banks... and I had only wanted to invest in SSB. Can I do it via online iBanking or thru ATM? Sorry for this noob question...2 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jay Liu, Sleepyhead at Land of Dreams Level 6. MasterAnswered on 11 Feb 2019Don't have to link with SSB.Your CDP account link to a bank account. After the linkage you can just buy the SSB issue from the bank app/ website/ head down to the atm. When purchasing e.g. $500 do have an extra $2 for the processing fee. So total amount will be $502 when purchasing. :) 0 comments1

Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 09 Feb 2019Hey, if you recall during the application, there was a bank account details to be filled up. Login to that particular bank's ibanking and you can apply for SSB there. You can take a look at this website: http://www.sgs.gov.sg/savingsbonds/Your-SSB/How-to-buy.aspx0 comments1
